intro: Mecardonia pubescens, commonly known as the hairy mecardonia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its hairy, glandular leaves and yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Mecardonia pubescens is often found in shrublands and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
